bibl.title: Letter fragment from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Amory H. Hutchinson, [1908?]

div1.p: Mabel Lazear expresses appreciation for the play about her husband, Jesse Lazear.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Amory H. Hutchinson, [1908?]

opener.dateline:
Cloyne Court Hotel
2600 Ridge Road
Berkeley, California

div1.p:
Would that
I might be able to make you
appreciate how much I value
your most interesting and de-
lightful letter.

What you have to relate about
'Yellow Jack' amazing as it is was
not exactly a surprise. I was
never informed that the play
was to be produced and it came
as a very painful surprise.

Ever since long ago when Doctor
Thayer wrote me how much he
C1
B17
admired your sonnets and since
I read 'Deep Country' I have wished
I might tell you how much I too
admire your work. 'Deep Country'
is to me a very moving and delightful
novel. It was such a pleasant
surprise to read a really great
American novel.

Your courteous considerations of
me in asking my permission to
allow the play to be produced is
greatly appreciated. and you must
realize how deeply I feel your
interest and appreciation of
my husband Dr Lazear's work
As soon as I have read 'Hard
Bargain' I will write you.
